text.__SUMMARY__: Shorea siamensis (called, along with some other species in the genus Shorea, dark red meranti, light red meranti, or red lauan) is a species of plant in the Dipterocarpaceae family. The tree is growing in most of Southeast Asia and is found in Myanmar, Malaysia, Thailand, Cambodia, Vietnam and Indonesia.
text.Uses: In Cambodia, this tree is rare and most often seen near Buddhist pagodas and shrines. According to legend one of Buddha's incarnations was born under an s. siamensis tree and therefore it has a strong symbolic connection to Cambodia's Buddhist culture. The leaves of the tree are used in traditional Cambodian medicine as a tea for easing child birth.
text.Names:
The tree is known by various local names:

Khmer: ឈើម្រាំងភ្ែាំ (Raing Phnom)
text.Sources: Ashton, P. (1998). "Shorea siamensis". The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. IUCN. 1998: e.T32307A9694077. doi:10.2305/IUCN.UK.1998.RLTS.T32307A9694077.en. Retrieved 22 December 2017.
